author: Jaykul
body:
Since PowerShell now has support for ignoring VT escape sequences (such as those for setting colors) to be ignored while calculating the widths of columns, this works (needs PowerShell 6 for `e):


Steps to reproduce
------------------
```powershell
$ColorTable = 789516, 14300928, 958739, 14521914, 2035653, 9967496, 40129, 13421772, 7763574, 16742459, 837142, 14079585, 5654759, 10354868, 10875385, 15921906

$backgrounds = @(
    foreach($bg in 0, 4, 2, 6, 1, 5, 3, 7) {
        @{
            Name = " 4${i}m "
            Expression = { 
                "`e[48;2;$($ColorTable[$bg] -band 0xff);$($ColorTable[$bg] -shr 8 -band 0xFF);$($ColorTable[$bg] -shr 16 -band 0xFF)m" +
                "`e[38;2;$($_ -band 0xff);$($_ -shr 8 -band 0xFF);$($_ -shr 16 -band 0xFF)m" +
                " gYw $([char]27)[0m"
            }.GetNewClosure()
        }
    }
)

$ColorTable[0, 8, 4, 12, 2, 10, 6, 14, 1, 9, 5, 13, 3, 11, 7, 15] | Format-Table $backgrounds -Force

$ColorTable[0, 8, 4, 12, 2, 10, 6, 14, 1, 9, 5, 13, 3, 11, 7, 15] | Format-Table $backgrounds -Force | Out-String
```


Expected behavior
-----------------

I expected using `Out-String` to have no effect on the output when it's just going to the console anyway...

```powershell
$ColorTable[0, 8, 4, 12, 2, 10, 6, 14, 1, 9, 5, 13, 3, 11, 7, 15] | Format-Table $backgrounds -Force
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/192942/44319099-cc0e0f80-a407-11e8-92e4-02dac76fafab.png)


Actual behavior
---------------

When piping through `Out-String` the width calculation is broken (notice that besides the output being a bit scrambled, the column widths are wrong:

```powershell
$ColorTable[0, 8, 4, 12, 2, 10, 6, 14, 1, 9, 5, 13, 3, 11, 7, 15] | Format-Table $backgrounds -Force | Out-String
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/192942/44319136-f95abd80-a407-11e8-8dd2-1e269a0d7beb.png)


Obviously I think Out-String should not affect the formatting width calculation. It would be great if we could also add a switch to strip VT escape sequences from the output...


Environment data
----------------
PowerShell 5.1 through PowerShell 6.1 pre-releases **on Windows 10**
title: BUG: Out-String doesn't handle VT escape sequences
